captions.text: I Respect Money ...because it can make you multidimensionally rich
"My talking to you has not the ordinary purpose that talking serves: indoctrination                      -- that is not the purpose of my talks.
I don't have any doctrine; my talking is really a process of dehypnosis.
Just listening to me, slowly, slowly you will be free of all the programs that the society has forced you to believe in."
What are all these feelings which are around money?
What makes it so powerful that people sacrifice their lives for it?
This is a very significant question.
All the religions have been against wealth
that can be purchased in life.
and exceptions always prove the rule.
Everything else you can purchase with money.
Because all the religions have been against life,
they were bound to be against money.
And a man who cannot understand classical music
all his senses will be perfectly right medically
who have not even heard the name of  The Book of Mirdad.
If I am to make a list of the great books,
But to see the beauty of it
is possible only if you learn
and it is a long learning.
It is not like jazz music,
for which no learning is needed.
in fact, only monkeys understand it.
and you think it is music.
You will find better music in a waterfall,
or when the wind blows through the pine trees,
in the forest in autumn on dry leaves,

comments.text:
I have listened to a number of OSHO videos and thought they made sense, 
then he made that comment about jazz and lost me. As a long time musician 
who can play both classical and jazz I can say without hesitation that he 
is completely wrong. Jazz is the higher form of expression, and one which 
takes more effort to learn and understand. Any child can learn to play 
classical music, appreciate it. He has exposed his limited understanding of 
music, of beauty, by that one comment and I am not sure what to make of him 
referring to monkeys in the process.﻿
comments.author: Gold Pill Scientist

comments.text:
Ok, one thing here: I'm currently studying jazz guitar in college and let 
me tell you: jazz music is probably THE most complex type of music out 
there. Because of its late entry in this world, jazz music benefits from 
atonal and chromatic language, sophisticated voice leading, much 
modulation, chord substitution and incredibly complex harmony. Many of 
these things, which brought an immense amount of new possibilities, were 
not yet discovered during the classical period, so jazz music is actually 
even harder to understand. Although I usually agree with Osho, this was an 
incredibly dumb thing to say. Instead, he should have used all the shitty 
commercial ''music'' that's all over the radio nowadays as an example. ﻿
comments.author: KingOfShadows1500

comments.text: WE LOVE OSHO AND H S 100% CORRECT﻿

comments.text:
It is ironic that Osho mentions Autumn Leaves, n freedom from prejudice, in 
describing d beauty of Classical Music, after saying that Jazz Music can 
only b understood by Monkeys. Osho has said many wise things n funny 
things, n I respect him. But even a wise man can b ignorant to a certain 
subject. In Music Jazz contains d very freedom itself n d Selfishness 
itself that Osho is talking about, in his former teachings. And one, many 
great classical musicians, eagerly n utterly gave their hearts, to obtain. 
  ﻿

comments.text:
jazz is pretty good, I love all music and I am a player. I think i got a 
perspective on it i thought of recently though. jazz vs classical. Jazz and 
hip hop and rock always comes from from lower chakras. got this idea 
through listening in meditation. So I agree with Osho, it is more often 
monkey-like, but more sophisticated. Classical music on the other hand is 
often from higher center inspiration and is more subtle and profound. I 
like to listen to music with my chakras.

comments.text:
There's no such genre as jazz. It's just another invented term. At the end 
of the day, it's all music. It's all sound. It's all subjective. I myself 
am a musician at beginner level. I plan on composing music and I completely 
respect Osho's views on Jazz. It's his opinion. We need to respect that.

comments.text:

allowed to like or dislike whatever they want.

comments.text:
All music is subjective. it's just arranged sounds, when you get right down 
to it. Different genres appeal to different tastes. One never has more 
intrinsic value than another. No form of music has any significance that 
the individual does not give to it. Personally, I like jazz. It embraces 
dissonance in a way that many other genres bypass. Those, who play jazz, 
have learned the rules of music and decided to break those rules; the 
essence of deviance and freedom. This is the value I give to it
comments.author: Joshua Thomas

comments.text:
Jazz is 98% a bowl of crap, compared to so-called classical, symphonic 
music. People used to compose music considering the blend of Tones of many 
different instruments, because each had beauty of its own, and Beauty was a 
strong motivator, which led to emotion, which led to melody. Nowadays 
people are totally happy with a bowl of 98% crap. We embrace stuff today 
that would have killed people like Chopin.

comments.text:
(continued) With (most) classical music and the music of nature however, 
you are instead required to learn how to listen deeply to it in order to 
derive feeling, meaning and emotion from it. Many modern music titles will 
implicitly tell you what you are supposed to feel listening to the song, it 
ruins the experience to a degree, classical music on the other hand, is 
usually named for the technical term for the style and perhaps a smalol 
hint at the composers feelings, nature has no title at all
comments.author: Eric Wolfharth

comments.text:
I thought he said "dance" music actually but I could be wrong. Aside from 
that, I don't feel his (Osho's) point was to say Jazz or Dance or any 
modern "music" isn't complex, I think he's differentiating what is "music" 
and what is "entertainment" in the sense of how it effects your 
metaphysical being. Jazz and other forms of modernish music will often have 
a set emotion or feeling that the performer is pushing onto you, almost 
like artificial feelings. (continued)
comments.author: Eric Wolfharth

comments.text:
Actually he says that there is difference between subject and object art,

basho or Gurdjieff sacred dance and many more.

I also disagree with Osho here that it is bad music but Jazz is basically

people. To me it seems that he still has to learn to listen to Jazz. You 
always have to learn to listen to a particular kind of music. Metal, 
HipHop, Electro etc can sound terrible the first time listening.

comments.text:
I, and all other musicians who have a deeper understanding of music, would 
disagree with Osho concerning the jazz music. In order to be able to play 
jazz, you have to understand how classical music is constructed (theory, 
etc.) and how it works FIRST OF ALL - it's the absolute foundation of jazz 
music and NOT vice versa. Jazz is a very (!) complexe and rich gerne - Osho 
shouldn't judge about it only because he doesn't have a understanding of 
this form of art.

comments.text:
Enlightenment is only a momentary vision of a fragment of perfection. 
Enlightenment is seeing for a brief while. Wisdom is possessing, for ever. 
The one is swift moving, the other a deep stillness. I Dont respect money, 
The little money I have is my biggest humility. PEACE
comments.author: superAlguitar

comments.text: True. I think Jazz is real classic. He probably meant heavy metal.
comments.author: Nokapp23

comments.text:
I bristle whenever I hear his comments on jazz. Classical music has been in 
me for as long as I can remember, but one thing I've observed over the 
years is that jazz (and funk for that matter--and who knows what else) 
attracts people who tend to be far freer in their minds than those who 
appreciate classical music, which is obviously one of the reasons it sounds 
the way it does. I find myself agreeing with much of his views, but that 
was an unfortunate and unusually closed-minded statement.
comments.author: mrboombasticx
